DatasetLink.Title: COHOWeb service

VariableDescription.Name: heliocentricDistance
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         Helios
#     SOURCE_NAME                     Helios-2
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Interplanetary Studies
#     DATA_TYPE                       COHO1HR>1 Hour Time Resolution from cohoweb
#     DESCRIPTOR                      MAG_PLASMA>Merged Trajectory, Magnetic Field, and Plasma
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     PI_NAME                         N. Ness, F. Neubauer, F. Mariani (magnetic field), H. Rosenbauer, R. Schwenn                           
#                                      (plasma) and J. Freeman                                                                               
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  all affiliated with ESA or NASA
#     TEXT                            The HELIOS-1 spacecraft was one of the pair of deep space probes developed by                          
#     TEXT                             the Federal Republic of Germany (FRG) in a cooperative program with NASA.                             
#     TEXT                             The purpose of the mission was to make pioneering measurements of the interplanetary                  
#     TEXT                             medium from the vicinity of the Earth's orbit to 0.3 AU. (The planet Mercury                          
#                                      is at 0.4 AU.)                                                                                        
#                                     Data coverage for selected parameters for this data set is: interplanetary                             
#                                      magnetic  field (1976-01-18 - 1980-03-04), solar wind plasma (1976-01-18 -                            
#                                      1980-03-04), and spacecraft trajectory coordinates (1976-01-18 - 1980-03-04).                         
#                                     Magnetic field data were provided by Prof. F. Mariani, Istituto di Fisica G.                           
#                                      Marconi, Rome, Italy; Plasma data - by Dr. R. Schwenn, Max-Planck-Institut                            
#                                      fur Aeronomie, Lindau, Germany.                                                                       
#                                     Time Coverage of merged files: January 1, 1976 - March 4, 1980.
#                                     Helios-2 data have been reprocessed to ensure a uniformity of content and coordinate                   
#                                      systems relative to data from other deep-space missions:                                              
#                                     All spacecraft trajectory data were transformed to a Heliographic Inertial (HGI)                       
#                                      coordinate system.                                                                                    
#                                     Magnetic field components were transformed to RTN system.
#                                     Trajectory data, interplanetary magnetic field data, and plasma data were merged                       
#                                      into individual hourly records.                                                                       
#                                     Data gaps were filled with dummy numbers for the missing hours or entire days                          
#                                      to make all files of equal length.  The character '9' is used to fill all fields                      
#                                      for missing data according to their format, e.g. ' 9999.9' for a field with                           
#                                      the FORTRAN format F7.1. Note that format F7.1 below really means (1X,F6.1),etc.                      
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#                                     Plasma and Solar Wind
#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Helios
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  helios2_coho1hr_merged_mag_plasma
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 helios2_coho1hr_merged_mag_plasma_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Helios-2 merged hourly magnetic field, plasma and ephermis data
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 hour
#     LINK_TEXT                       COHO dataset
#                                     Additional analysis tools for these data from the
#     LINK_TITLE                      Documentation
#                                     COHOWeb service
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cohoweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/html/cw_data.html
#                                     http://cohoweb.gsfc.nasa.gov
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:43:10 2015

#                                     Data coverage for selected parameters for this data set is: interplanetary                             
#                                      magnetic  field (1976-01-18 - 1980-03-04), solar wind plasma (1976-01-18 -

#     LINK_TEXT                       COHO dataset

#                                      into individual hourly records.

VariableDescription.Name: protonTemp
VariableDescription.Header:
# ******************************************************* 
#  WARNING: Increase time period selected for listing. 
# ******************************************************* 
# 
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         Helios
#     SOURCE_NAME                     Helios-2
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Interplanetary Studies
#     DATA_TYPE                       COHO1HR>1 Hour Time Resolution from cohoweb
#     DESCRIPTOR                      MAG_PLASMA>Merged Trajectory, Magnetic Field, and Plasma
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     PI_NAME                         N. Ness, F. Neubauer, F. Mariani (magnetic field), H. Rosenbauer, R. Schwenn                           
#                                      (plasma) and J. Freeman                                                                               
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  all affiliated with ESA or NASA
#     TEXT                            The HELIOS-1 spacecraft was one of the pair of deep space probes developed by                          
#     TEXT                             the Federal Republic of Germany (FRG) in a cooperative program with NASA.                             
#     TEXT                             The purpose of the mission was to make pioneering measurements of the interplanetary                  
#     TEXT                             medium from the vicinity of the Earth's orbit to 0.3 AU. (The planet Mercury                          
#                                      is at 0.4 AU.)                                                                                        
#                                     Data coverage for selected parameters for this data set is: interplanetary                             
#                                      magnetic  field (1976-01-18 - 1980-03-04), solar wind plasma (1976-01-18 -                            
#                                      1980-03-04), and spacecraft trajectory coordinates (1976-01-18 - 1980-03-04).                         
#                                     Magnetic field data were provided by Prof. F. Mariani, Istituto di Fisica G.                           
#                                      Marconi, Rome, Italy; Plasma data - by Dr. R. Schwenn, Max-Planck-Institut                            
#                                      fur Aeronomie, Lindau, Germany.                                                                       
#                                     Time Coverage of merged files: January 1, 1976 - March 4, 1980.
#                                     Helios-2 data have been reprocessed to ensure a uniformity of content and coordinate                   
#                                      systems relative to data from other deep-space missions:                                              
#                                     All spacecraft trajectory data were transformed to a Heliographic Inertial (HGI)                       
#                                      coordinate system.                                                                                    
#                                     Magnetic field components were transformed to RTN system.
#                                     Trajectory data, interplanetary magnetic field data, and plasma data were merged                       
#                                      into individual hourly records.                                                                       
#                                     Data gaps were filled with dummy numbers for the missing hours or entire days                          
#                                      to make all files of equal length.  The character '9' is used to fill all fields                      
#                                      for missing data according to their format, e.g. ' 9999.9' for a field with                           
#                                      the FORTRAN format F7.1. Note that format F7.1 below really means (1X,F6.1),etc.                      
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#                                     Plasma and Solar Wind
#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Helios
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  helios2_coho1hr_merged_mag_plasma
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 helios2_coho1hr_merged_mag_plasma_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Helios-2 merged hourly magnetic field, plasma and ephermis data
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 1 hour
#     LINK_TEXT                       COHO dataset
#                                     Additional analysis tools for these data from the
#     LINK_TITLE                      Documentation
#                                     COHOWeb service
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://cohoweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/html/cw_data.html
#                                     http://cohoweb.gsfc.nasa.gov
#
#
